str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From a (long) distance, afar. Adverb from makros; from a distance or afar.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The breast, chest. From histemi; the bosom, i.e. Chest.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) To have mercy on, show favor to, (b) trans. with object of sins: To forgive, pardon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
